title: The â€œPhantomâ€ French Manicure Takes Cat-Eye Tips To The Next Level
text:
The â€œPhantomâ€ French Manicure Takes Cat-Eye Tips To The Next Level

They say youÂ canâ€™tÂ beat a classic, but if my Instagram feed is anything to go by, the humbleÂ French manicureÂ is undergoing something of a makeover. It began with the â€œFrench fadeâ€,Â aÂ lookÂ that blends theÂ French manicureâ€™s signature white tip into the nailâ€™s neutral base for a soft, melted ombrÃ© effect. Another recentÂ favoriteÂ is theÂ â€œdeepâ€ French: a chunkier take on the traditional tip that pays homage to the early â€™00s. Fast forward to February and another trend has entered our radar â€” whatÂ weâ€™reÂ coining the â€œphantomâ€ FrenchÂ â€” andÂ itâ€™sÂ one forÂ French manicureÂ andÂ cat-eye nailÂ obsessives alike.Â 

What is the phantom French manicure?Â 

Before we get into the nitty-gritty,Â cat-eye French tipsÂ are nothing new, relying on a magnet to maneuver metal particles into formation, creating a reflective, velvety effect â€” much like a catâ€™s eye in the dark.Â In thatÂ instance, however, the cat-eye polish is usually painted as a French tip over a neutral gel base.Â The â€œphantomâ€ French is a little different. This time, the entire nail is coated in cat-eye polish, but the magnet is used in a way that draws only some â€” not all â€” of the particles to the tip, creating a French tip effect. Depending on the light or the movement of your fingers, the French tip seems to appear and disappear, hence the â€œphantomâ€ part.Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ĞœĞĞĞ˜ĞšĞ®Ğ  ĞĞĞšĞ¢ĞĞŸĞ›ĞĞ¡Ğ¢Ğ˜ĞšĞ | ĞŸĞ›Ğ•Ğ’Ğ•Ğ ğŸ’…ğŸ» (@koleva.nails)

Natalia Mercedes, nail artist and founder of Sad Girl Nails Studio in New York City, has a theory about whyÂ weâ€™reÂ gravitating toward a more subtle take on the French manicure: â€œThereâ€™s definitely a renewed interest in softer, more understated French tips,â€ says Mercedes, â€œbut at the same time, bold and graphic French designs are just as relevant.â€ Its recent popularity stems from its subtlety, Mercedes adds. â€œItâ€™s a modern evolution of a classic that feels especially sleek right now,â€ she says, â€œbutÂ itâ€™sÂ less about one trend replacing another. Instead,Â itâ€™sÂ about the range of expression people are embracing.â€Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Uzaifa Hawkins (@uzaifahawkins)

How do you achieve the phantom French manicure?Â 

The â€œphantomâ€ French manicure requires a skilled hand, and everyoneÂ seems to doÂ it a little differently. On Instagram, digital creator and nail artist Melanie Graves paints her nails with silver cat-eye polish, then places a magnet on either side of the nail to draw the particles inward into a reflective formation. Before curing, she positions a longer magnet at the center of the nail, pushing the magnetic pigments toward the tip to create negative space. The result? A cat-eye French tipÂ thatâ€™sÂ only visible at certain angles.Â 

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Fariha Ali (@nailjob)

Mercedes has her own method. â€œThe â€˜phantomâ€™ effect in cat-eye French tips comes down to both layering and magnet technique,â€ she says, adding, â€œItâ€™s about guiding the magnetic particles with intention, then letting light do the rest.â€ As the nail catches different angles, MercedesÂ explains,Â the design appears to shift, fade, and re-emerge. â€œThis creates an illusion of movement.â€Â 

While it might sound a little complicated,Â a qualifiedÂ nail tech will know exactly what to do. If in doubt, arrive armed with plenty of reference images. The phantom French manicure works on all nail shapes, from almond, like these by Koleva, to squoval, like this set posted to Instagram by @Nai__Spa.

Here are a few more of our favorite â€œphantomâ€ French tip nail looks for your perusal.Â 

Lavender French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ĞœĞĞĞ˜ĞšĞ®Ğ  ĞĞĞšĞ¢ĞĞŸĞ›ĞĞ¡Ğ¢Ğ˜ĞšĞ | ĞŸĞ›Ğ•Ğ’Ğ•Ğ ğŸ’…ğŸ» (@koleva.nails)

Nail artistÂ Sisa Koleva, aka @koleva.nails,Â used a lilac cat-eye shade to create a subtle French tip on these satisfyingly square nails. Swipe to see the phantom French tip in action â€” one minuteÂ itâ€™sÂ there, the nextÂ itâ€™sÂ gone.Â 

Neutral French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Polish'd Nail Bar (@polishdnailbartoronto)

We love this neutral set posted to Instagram by Polishâ€™d Nail Bar. The cat-eye polish closely matches the gel base, subtly blurring the line between the tip and the rest of the nail.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Nai spa (@nai__spa)

Pixie Dust Cat Eye

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ami kai (@amikainails)

The way the magnetic particles on Ami Kaiâ€™s nails are drawn toward the tip to create this French effect makes them look as thoughÂ theyâ€™veÂ been topped with pixie dust.Â 

Frosted French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ğ— ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—¸ğ—¶ ğ—¡ğ—®ğ—¶ğ—¹ğ˜€ ğ—–ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—³ğ—³ (@meraki_nails_cardiff)

Meraki Nails Cardiff layered TheÂ GelBottleâ€™sÂ Sterling gel over builder gel in Dolly to create this frosted French effect, which disappears and reappears depending on the light.Â 

Pink Champagne French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by ĞœĞĞĞ˜ĞšĞ®Ğ  ĞĞĞšĞ¢ĞĞŸĞ›ĞĞ¡Ğ¢Ğ˜ĞšĞ | ĞŸĞ›Ğ•Ğ’Ğ•Ğ ğŸ’…ğŸ» (@koleva.nails)

Hereâ€™sÂ another phantom French tip by Koleva, this time in a pink champagne finish on long,Â squovalÂ nails.Â 

Illuminated French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Jade | Beauty Content Creator (@jadelamanna)

Content creator Jadeâ€™s nails look bathed in sunlight, thanks to a layer of champagne gold cat-eye polish that catches the light at just the right angle to reveal these phantom French tips.Â 

Blush French

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Syd âœ· Land of Hands âœ· Nail Artist (@landofhands)

Syd, a nail artist at Land of Hands, created this blush pink almond set using a rose quartz cat-eye polish.Â

title: Your 2026 Valentineâ€™s Day Tarot Reading Is Here
text:
Your 2026 Valentineâ€™s Day Tarot Reading Is Here February is the month we mostly associate with love and our heartâ€™s deepest desires. While Valentineâ€™s Day can be performative and capitalistic, Spirit is asking you to drop whatâ€™s surface level and get more intimate with yourself. This month, center the relationship you have with your inner knowing. Your heart has been holding the truth this whole time. It knows what needs to shift, what you've been avoiding, and what you actually want but haven't let yourself say out loud. You've been overriding it with logic, drowning it out with productivity, and silencing it because what it's asking for feels too vulnerable, too big, and too real.

With that, this month's Tarotscopes goes straight to the point, cuts through the noise, and gives you direct access to what your heart has been trying to tell you about 2026. This is the year you get to reconnect to your own innate wisdom and allow that to lead you.

Read for your sun, moon, and rising, let your heart respond, and then be brave enough to listen.

title: 3 Helpful Tips If Youâ€™re In A â€œBad Relationshipâ€ With Your Autoimmune Condition
text:
3 Helpful Tips If Youâ€™re In A â€œBad Relationshipâ€ With Your Autoimmune Condition

Sponsored by Novartis Pharmaceuticals Corporation, and Emmeka and Dr. Gupta were compensated by Novartis.

A tingle that turns into an itch that only becomes worse as you scratch it. A feeling that may resemble mosquito bites all over your body. Trouble sleeping, work disruptions, and skipped social events spurred by the anxiety of the hives returning. Thatâ€™s what flare-ups can be like for people living with chronic spontaneous urticaria (CSU) â€” an immune-mediated disease characterized by hives and/or deep swelling for more than 6 weeks without a known allergy or external triggers.

When Emmeka, an Iowa-based social media manager and beauty content creator, first noticed itchy, red, welt-like bumps across her back, she worried she was experiencing an allergic reaction. For months, she tried to rule out what might be causing symptoms and considered everything from laundry detergent and beauty products to the food she was eating. â€œI was continuously trying to figure out what was happening to me and editing my lifestyle to avoid potential triggers; it was a burden,â€ Emmeka recalls. After a long journey of trying to get to the root cause of her persistent hives, she finally got a diagnosis of CSU.

Living with CSU can feel like being in a bad relationship: compromising, downplaying your needs, and feeling stuck in a cycle of discomfort and frustration.

Dr. Payel Gupta, a New York Cityâ€“based allergist who treats people with CSU, is working to raise awareness of this condition and empower patients to find solutions that work for them. â€œLiving with CSU shouldnâ€™t mean settling for discomfort,â€ says Dr. Gupta. â€œCSU is something you and your doctor can work on together. Itâ€™s a partnership, and that means good communication about whatâ€™s working, whatâ€™s not working, so we can find the right management plan.â€

Dr. Gupta and Emmeka recently sat down together to discuss what it means to Â be proactive in taking more control of your life with CSU and shared key tips for improving your â€œrelationshipâ€ with this chronic condition.

Keep reading for Dr. Guptaâ€™s advice on how to get a better sense of control in your journey with CSU.Â 

It took Emmeka 2 years to receive her CSU diagnosis â€” a delay thatâ€™s all too common, as the average time to diagnosis for CSU is over 2 years. Dr. Gupta recommends that patients presenting with symptoms of CSU connect with a specialist, such as an allergist or dermatologist, who is familiar with CSU and the standard diagnostic and treatment protocols for this condition.

â€œTheyâ€™ll help you develop a concrete plan of action for when youâ€™re having an acute episode, so that you donâ€™t feel lost or confused and end up needing to seek urgent care,â€ Dr. Gupta continues. â€œSeeing a specialist can be a really important step toward getting the help you need to manage this condition in the long term.â€Â 

Itâ€™s also important that you feel like you can fully open up to your health care provider. â€œYou want to have good communication on both sides. So, if you feel like youâ€™re not being heard or like youâ€™re unable to express yourself, then itâ€™s important to get a second opinion to make sure your concerns can be addressed,â€ Dr. Gupta says.

After coming to terms with her CSU, Emmeka decided to share her journey online and was met with support and stories from her online community, empowering her to use her platform as a content creator to raise awareness.Â 

â€œCommunity is really important because it reminds you that youâ€™re not alone,â€ says Dr. Gupta. â€œSeeing your lived experience mirrored in others helps you feel validated and understood.â€Â 

Social media, in particular, can be a valuable space for connection. But Dr. Gupta warns about relying too heavily on advice from non-medical sources: â€œUse social media for community, but when seeking information, turn to qualified medical professionals and resources based on reputable references, like Never Just Hives.â€

â€œThe biggest misconception is that thereâ€™s an allergic trigger,â€ Dr. Gupta explains. â€œSome patients blame themselves, thinking their actions caused the symptoms. But the truth is, youâ€™ve done nothing wrong.â€

CSU isnâ€™t triggered by external factors like allergies, foods, or environmental irritants. Instead, itâ€™s caused by an overactive immune system. For many patients like Emmeka, the spontaneous nature of this condition can be hard to come to terms with. But listening to your body is a powerful first step.Â 

If you canâ€™t identify a specific trigger, it could be a sign that something else deeper is going on, like CSU.Â 

Dr. Gupta encourages patients to stay connected to their bodies by tracking symptoms and taking photos during flare-ups. This can help facilitate productive conversations with your doctor, and enable you both to work together to find a path forward.

For helpful tips, explainers, a library of trusted resources, and all things CSU, check out Never Just Hives.Â

title: The OPI Color Combo Behind Hailey Bieberâ€™s Hazelnut Nails At The Grammys
text:
The OPI Color Combo Behind Hailey Bieberâ€™s Hazelnut Nails At The Grammys

The 2026 Grammy Awards red carpet was a treasure trove of manicure trends. From FKA twigs to KATSEYE, the stars delivered enough nail inspiration to last theÂ entireÂ year â€” but Hailey Bieber stood out, especially since her look was made entirely with OPI. This time, though, it had nothing to do with Funny Bunny, the shade behind her iconic â€œglazed donutâ€ nails.Â 

Bieber swapped her signature blush for a hazelnut-americano-inspired hue, carefully mixed by her longtime friend and LA-based nail artist ZolaÂ Ganzorigt. While appointments withÂ GanzorigtÂ are rare, she took to Instagram to reveal the exact color combination for those whoÂ donâ€™tÂ mindÂ performing aÂ little nailÂ alchemy.Â Â 

Once a base coat was appliedÂ (a must for boosting wear and protecting nails from stains),Â GanzorigtÂ mixedÂ no less than four shadesÂ â€”Â OPIâ€™s Cliffside Karaoke, Big Apple Red,Â Barefoot In Barcelona,Â and YouÂ Donâ€™t Know Jacques!Â â€”Â a few drops at a time to create this chocolatey, hazelnut-inspired shade, perfectlyÂ matched toÂ Bieberâ€™s lipstick.Â â€œ[We] felt like we were in chemistry class while we were mixing the colors to create the perfect shade,â€Â GanzorigtÂ said on Instagram.Â Of course, a generous slick of OPIÂ top coatÂ was theÂ final step.Â 

WhileÂ GanzorigtÂ used OPIâ€™s professionalÂ GelColorÂ shades for Bieberâ€™s Grammy Awards manicure â€” a system found in most nail salons â€” all three shades are also available for at-home use in OPIâ€™s Nail Lacquer and Infinite Shine ranges online.Â 

The likes ofÂ Big Apple Red and YouÂ Donâ€™tÂ Know Jacques! are considered classics among manicurists, but BarefootÂ InÂ Barcelona is one of those shades that has slipped under the radar until now. It occupies a cozy space between blush pink and hazelnut, and its neutral finish suits all skin tones equally.Â Â 

AddedÂ them all to your cart? Shop 10 more OPI shades we predictÂ youâ€™llÂ see everywhere in 2026 and beyond.Â

title: Your Horoscope This Week: February 1 To 7
text:
Your Horoscope This Week: February 1 To 7

Cosmic beings, this week opens loud. The Leo Full Moon on February 1st is not subtle, not chill, and definitely not interested in you playing it cool. This is the kind of Full Moon that asks, â€œAre you actually proud of your life right now, or are you just busy?â€ Emotions are heightened, egos are tender, and everyone suddenly has a realization they cannot keep to themselves. The challenge is not letting every feeling turn into a performance. The gift is clarity. Something reaches a peak, a reveal, or a moment of truth that says, this matters more than youâ€™ve been admitting.Â 

Adding to the shake-up, Uranus stations direct in Taurus this week, and while it may not come with fireworks, it does come with a sense of momentum finally clicking into place. Think less chaos, more â€œohâ€¦ this is actually happening.â€ Changes around money, stability, values, or long-term plans may feel more real and less theoretical now. If something has been brewing quietly for months, this is when it starts to move forward without asking for permission. The key is flexibility. Taurus energy loves comfort, Uranus loves disruption, and this week asks you to find a middle ground between clinging and completely blowing things up.Â 

As the weekend begins, the vibe softens as Mercury enters Pisces, giving the collective permission to stop over-explaining and start feeling things again. Logic takes a backseat to intuition, creativity, and emotional nuance. Communication becomes less about facts and more about tone, timing, and whatâ€™s not being said. This is a great week for dreaming, journaling, art, and letting yourself be a little delusional in a hopeful way. Just remember, Mercury in Pisces can blur lines, so double-check details and be gentle with misunderstandings. Not everything needs an immediate answer. Some things just need space to unfold.

Read your horoscopes for your Sun and Rising signs for the most in-depth forecast.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Aries Sun & Rising:

Aries, are you ready to admit what actually lights you up instead of reacting to every spark that comes your way? This week starts with the Leo Full Moon, and for you it feels like a creative or emotional mic drop. Something youâ€™ve been working on, flirting with, or quietly hoping for hits a peak, and suddenly you canâ€™t pretend you donâ€™t care anymore. This could be about love, joy, passion, or a project that feels very you. The temptation is to go full â€œall eyes on meâ€ and burn yourself out trying to prove a point. The smarter move is choosing what deserves your energy instead of reacting to every feeling that shows up. Not every spark needs to become a wildfire.Â 

Meanwhile, Uranus finally stations direct in Taurus, and you may notice a subtle but real shift around money, confidence, or how secure you feel in your choices. This isnâ€™t a lottery-ticket moment, itâ€™s more like realizing you trust yourself again. Financial ideas or plans that felt unstable now feel workable, and youâ€™re less interested in proving your worth to anyone. If something clicks this week, follow it, but donâ€™t rush it. Momentum doesnâ€™t need chaos to be powerful.Â 

On Friday, Mercury enters Pisces, which is basically your cue to stop explaining yourself so much. Your intuition is louder than logic right now, and forcing clarity will only slow things down. You may feel more introspective, tired, or oddly nostalgic, even as big things are unfolding. Let that happen. This is a behind-the-scenes processing week, not a launch week. Trust that what youâ€™re integrating now is quietly preparing you for a much louder chapter ahead.

Taurus Sun & Rising:

Taurus, something youâ€™ve been emotionally sitting with is ready to move and this week makes it impossible to keep pretending otherwise. The week opens with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st, and for you it lands right in your feelings. Home, family, living situations, and emotional safety are all under a bright spotlight. Something reaches a turning point, a realization, a boundary, or even a decision youâ€™ve been avoiding because it felt â€œtoo much.â€ The temptation here is to dig your heels in or react defensively. The growth comes from being honest about what no longer feels supportive. You donâ€™t need to blow anything up, but you do need to stop pretending everything is fine if itâ€™s not.Â 

Then on February 3rd, Uranus finally stations direct in your sign, and this is big, even if it feels quiet at first. After months of internal recalibration, identity shifts, and stop-start momentum, things begin to move forward with more confidence. You may feel clearer about who you are becoming, less reactive to other peopleâ€™s expectations, and more willing to choose yourself without over-explaining. This isnâ€™t about instant transformation. Itâ€™s about finally trusting the changes youâ€™ve already made. If youâ€™ve been waiting for permission to move differently, consider this it.Â 

As the weekend begins, Mercury enters Pisces, softening your mental pace and turning your attention toward friends, community, and shared dreams. Conversations feel more intuitive than logical, and you may crave emotional resonance over surface-level chatter. This is a great time to reconnect with people who get you or to daydream about the future without locking yourself into a plan yet. Just be mindful of mixed signals or vague commitments. Youâ€™re allowed to dream big this week, just donâ€™t promise more than youâ€™re ready to deliver.Â 

Gemini Sun & Rising:

Gemini, a conversation, realization, or idea is reaching a point where thinking about it is no longer enough. The week begins with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st, lighting up your communication, ideas, and day-to-day interactions. Expect a conversation, realization, or announcement that feels bigger than you anticipated. Something youâ€™ve been thinking about for a while finally needs to be said, shared, or decided. The danger here is talking just to fill the silence or reacting emotionally before youâ€™ve processed the full picture. Choose intention over impulse. Your words carry extra weight right now, so make sure they reflect what you actually mean.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, activating your subconscious, intuition, and behind-the-scenes sector. This is less about external change and more about internal clarity. Insights may arrive in strange ways, dreams, random thoughts, or sudden emotional realizations that explain why youâ€™ve been feeling restless or distracted lately. Instead of trying to logic your way through everything, trust what your intuition is revealing. Something youâ€™ve quietly outgrown becomes undeniable this week.Â 

Mercury, your ruling planet, enters Pisces on February 6th, shifting your focus toward career, reputation, and long-term goals. The vibe becomes less linear and more imaginative. You may feel inspired about your future but slightly fuzzy on the details. Thatâ€™s okay. This isnâ€™t the moment to lock in a five-year plan. Itâ€™s about letting yourself envision what success could look like without immediately editing yourself. Just double-check emails and expectations. Mercury in Pisces prefers poetry over bullet points, and misunderstandings are easier if youâ€™re not paying attention.Â Â 

Cancer Sun & Rising:

Cancer, this week asks you to get honest about what feels truly secure versus what youâ€™ve been holding onto out of habit. The week opens with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st, activating your money, self-worth, and stability sector. As a moon-ruled sign, youâ€™ll feel this one deeply. Emotions around finances, value, or what youâ€™re giving versus receiving may rise to the surface. A purchase, payment, or realization could force you to ask, â€œIs this actually worth my energy?â€ The temptation is emotional spending or overreacting to temporary insecurity. The growth comes from recognizing how far youâ€™ve come and choosing confidence over fear, even if things donâ€™t feel perfectly settled yet.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, bringing momentum to your friendship, community, and long-term goals sector. If social dynamics have felt unpredictable or exhausting over the past few months, this shift helps things stabilize in a new way. You may feel clearer about who belongs in your inner circle and which group spaces feel aligned with your future. Unexpected opportunities through friends or networks could also reappear, this time with more follow-through. Stay open, but donâ€™t overcommit. Youâ€™re learning discernment, not withdrawal.Â 

Mercury enters Pisces on February 6th, harmonizing beautifully with your Cancer energy. Your intuition sharpens, your imagination expands, and you may feel drawn to dream, plan, or reflect rather than act. Conversations take on a more emotional tone, and you may feel inspired to think about travel, education, or spiritual growth. Just be mindful of assumptions. Mercury in Pisces is poetic, but not always precise. Let yourself dream big this week, but keep one foot on solid ground.Â 

Leo Sun & Rising:

Leo, the spotlight is on you and the real question is whether you want to perform or actually be seen. This is your week, Leo, and it starts exactly how youâ€™d expect with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st lighting up your identity, confidence, and â€œthis is who I am nowâ€ sector. Emotions are big, visibility is unavoidable, and something about you comes into full view, whether thatâ€™s a personal decision, a creative reveal, or a moment where you realize youâ€™ve outgrown an old version of yourself. The shadow here is overreacting or taking everything personally. Not every spotlight moment requires a dramatic speech. Sometimes the power move is quiet confidence.Â 

Then on February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, shaking things up in your career and public image zone, but in a way that feels more intentional than chaotic. If work, reputation, or long-term goals have felt unpredictable, this shift brings clarity around whatâ€™s actually worth building. You may realize you want something diï¬€erent than you did a year ago, or that success doesnâ€™t need to look the way you were taught it should. Expect subtle momentum rather than instant results. The key is staying flexible instead of clinging to a title or plan just because it once felt secure.Â 

As the weekend begins, Mercury enters Pisces, shifting your focus toward intimacy, trust, and emotional honesty. Conversations go deeper, feelings get softer, and you may crave connection over applause. This is a good time to talk about whatâ€™s really going on beneath the confidence, but be mindful of assumptions or mixed signals. Mercury in Pisces speaks in vibes, not bullet points. Let yourself feel without needing to define everything immediately. You donâ€™t have to have all the answers this week. Being present is more than enough.

Virgo Sun & Rising:

Virgo, the universe is quietly asking you to slow down long enough to notice what your body and intuition have been trying to say. The week begins with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st, lighting up your rest, healing, and subconscious sector. This is one of those Full Moons that doesnâ€™t shout, it whispersâ€¦ and then refuses to be ignored. You may feel more tired than usual, emotionally sensitive, or suddenly aware of something youâ€™ve been pushing down. The temptation is to analyze the feeling away or stay busy to avoid it. The better move is rest. Seriously. Something needs closure, and clarity comes faster when you stop trying to control the process.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, activating your expansion, learning, and belief sector. This brings forward momentum around plans involving travel, education, publishing, or a shift in perspective youâ€™ve been circling for months. An idea that once felt too risky may now feel oddly doable. This isnâ€™t about leaping without looking, but about trusting that growth doesnâ€™t always come with a spreadsheet. Let curiosity guide you a little more than certainty this week.Â 

As the weekend begins, Mercury, your ruling planet, enters Pisces, putting relationships and one-on-one dynamics into focus. Conversations feel more emotional and less linear, which can beâ€¦ uncomfortable for you. You may need to read between the lines or sit with ambiguity instead of demanding immediate clarity. Misunderstandings are possible, but so is deeper connection. Listen with empathy, not just logic. This week reminds you that not everything needs fixing. Some things just need to be felt.

Libra Sun & Rising:

Libra, this week reveals who and what actually belongs in the future youâ€™re trying to build. The week kicks oï¬€ with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st, spotlighting your friendships, community, and long-term goals. A social dynamic, group project, or vision for your future reaches a turning point, and you may suddenly feel clear about whoâ€™s actually aligned with where youâ€™re headed. The temptation is people-pleasing or trying to keep everyone happy. The growth comes from choosing authenticity over harmony-for-harmonyâ€™s-sake. Not every bridge is meant to be maintained.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, activating your intimacy, shared resources, and emotional depth sector. This brings a subtle but meaningful shift around trust, vulnerability, or finances tied to others. If certain emotional patterns or entanglements have felt unpredictable, this direct motion helps you regain balance and perspective. Youâ€™re less reactive and more grounded in what youâ€™re willing to share and what youâ€™re not. That clarity is powerful, even if it feels uncomfortable at first.Â 

As the weekend kicks off, Mercury enters Pisces, turning your attention toward work, routines, and well-being. The vibe becomes softer and less structured, which may test your desire for balance and order. You may feel inspired to care for yourself in more intuitive ways, but itâ€™s also easy to overcommit or blur boundaries. Be gentle with yourself. This is a week for adjusting rhythms, not perfecting them. Balance isnâ€™t about doing everything, itâ€™s about doing what actually supports you.Â 

Scorpio Sun & Rising:

Scorpio, are you ready for things to finally click in your professional life without you having to overly control the process? The week opens with the Leo Full Moon on February 1st, lighting up your career, reputation, and visibility sector. Something comes to a head professionally, recognition, a decision, or a moment where you realize how youâ€™re being perceived. You may feel pressure to perform or to prove yourself, but the real question is whether the path youâ€™re on actually feels aligned. The shadow here is overworking or staying quiet about your needs. The power move is owning your accomplishments and your boundaries. You donâ€™t need to downplay your talents to stay in control.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, shifting the energy in your partnership and one-on-one relationship sector. If dynamics with a partner, collaborator, or close friend have felt unpredictable, this direct motion brings a sense of recalibration. Not everything is suddenly stable, but youâ€™re clearer about what you want and what youâ€™re no longer willing to tolerate. Conversations may feel more honest, even if theyâ€™re a little uncomfortable. This is about progress, not perfection.Â 

Then on Friday the 6th Mercury enters Pisces, harmonizing with your Scorpio energy and softening the pace. Creativity, romance, and emotional expression take center stage, and you may feel more open than usual about what you want and feel. This is a great time to reconnect with pleasure, play, or a passion project, but be mindful of mixed signals or idealizing situations too quickly. Let things unfold naturally. This week reminds you that intensity doesnâ€™t always need armor. Sometimes it just needs space.Â 

Sagittarius Sun & Rising:

Sag, are you ready to say yes to a bigger vision even if you donâ€™t have all the details figured out yet? The Leo Full Moon on February 1st lights up your sector of growth, travel, learning, and belief systems, pushing a long-standing idea, plan, or desire to reach a moment of truth. You may feel inspired, restless, or eager to expand your world, but the shadow here is overpromising or assuming enthusiasm alone will carry you through. Let this Full Moon remind you that belief is powerful, but commitment is what makes it real.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, bringing forward momentum in your work and daily routine sector. If your schedule, responsibilities, or job dynamics have felt inconsistent, this shift helps you regain traction. A new rhythm begins to form, one that asks you to work smarter, not harder. Small changes in how you manage your time or energy can have a big impact now. Stay flexible. The more open you are to doing things differently, the more freedom you actually gain.Â 

Then Mercury enters Pisces on February 6th, drawing your attention toward home, emotional grounding, and personal space. You may crave comfort, nostalgia, or quiet reflection after a mentally busy week. Conversations with family or about living situations may feel more emotional than logical, so listen carefully and avoid jumping to conclusions. This is a good moment to slow down, recharge, and let your intuition guide you. Not every adventure requires movement. Some growth happens when you let yourself settle.Â 

Capricorn Sun & Rising:

Capricorn, are you ready to stop carrying everything like itâ€™s your personal responsibility to hold the world together? The Leo Full Moon on February 1st activates your intimacy, trust, and shared-resources sector, bringing a moment of truth around emotional or financial entanglements. This could look like a boundary conversation, a realization about power dynamics, or finally acknowledging where youâ€™ve been over-giving. The shadow is shutting down or trying to control the outcome. The growth is letting yourself be supported without guilt.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, energizing your creativity, joy, and self-expression sector. If youâ€™ve felt blocked, uninspired, or hesitant to take a risk with something you love, momentum starts returning. This isnâ€™t about reckless leaps, but about remembering that pleasure and play are not distractions from success. Theyâ€™re fuel. Let yourself experiment without needing a perfect plan.Â 

As the weekend hits, Mercury enters Pisces, softening your communication style and inviting more emotional nuance into conversations. You may find yourself speaking from the heart rather than the spreadsheet, which is a shift, but a healthy one. Just double-check details and expectations. Not everything needs to be finalized this week. Some ideas just need room to breathe.Â 

Aquarius Sun & Rising:

Aquarius, yes, this week is about you, but not in the way youâ€™re used to. The Leo Full Moon on February 1st lights up your relationship sector, bringing clarity around partnerships, situationships, or close collaborations. Something reaches a peak, a decision, a realization, or an emotional moment you canâ€™t intellectualize your way out of. The shadow is detachment or defensiveness. The lesson is presence. You donâ€™t lose your independence by being emotionally available.Â 

Then on February 3rd, Uranus, your modern ruler, stations direct in Taurus, shifting energy around home, family, and emotional foundations. Things that felt unstable or uncertain start making more sense, even if theyâ€™re still evolving. You may feel clearer about where you belong or what kind of support you actually need. This isnâ€™t about locking things down. Itâ€™s about choosing stability on your own terms.Â 

As Mercury enters Pisces on February 6th, your focus turns toward money, values, and self-worth. Conversations around finances or priorities may feel less logical and more emotional. Trust your intuition, but donâ€™t ignore practical details. This week asks you to align your values with your choices, not just your ideas.Â 

Pisces Sun & Rising:

Pisces, this week asks you to be honest about whatâ€™s draining you versus whatâ€™s actually sustaining you. The Leo Full Moon on February 1st illuminates your work, health, and daily routine sector, bringing a realization about habits, obligations, or responsibilities that need adjusting. You may feel called to do less, not more. The shadow is martyrdom. The growth is choosing yourself without needing permission.Â 

On February 3rd, Uranus stations direct in Taurus, bringing momentum to your communication, mindset, and learning sector. If conversations have felt stuck or plans unclear, things begin moving forward with more confidence. Ideas land diï¬€erently now. You may feel more willing to speak up or share something youâ€™ve been sitting on. Trust that your voice matters, even if it shakes a little.Â 

As the weekend arrives, Mercury enters your sign, putting your thoughts, feelings, and intuition front and center. Youâ€™re more expressive, imaginative, and emotionally tuned in, but also more sensitive to tone and energy. This is a great time to journal, create, or talk things through with someone you trust. Just remember, not every feeling needs immediate action. Some insights unfold when you give them space.Â

title: The Full Snow Moon In Leo Is Here â€”Â & It Marks A Time Of Renewal For You
text:
The Full Snow Moon In Leo Is Here â€”Â & It Marks A Time Of Renewal For You

Get ready to roar! The Full Snow Moon in Leo on February 1st demands that we take charge. How? By fighting for fairness and equality, while simultaneously asking us to care for others with compassion and empathy (sharing this with our frenemies and nemeses will be hard, but valuable in teaching them to be kind). The remedy for upsets is to be sympathetic and fierce, making tough love the best approach.Â IfÂ we are going from a pure position, we can make the world and our lives a more magical and tender place to be. First, weÂ have toÂ be aggressive and loud to be effective in getting the word out about the causes we believe in to ensure people are listening.Â 

The Snow Moon marks a time of renewal in the depths of winter in the Northern Hemisphere. Due to the weather, the world slows down, allowing us to be more introspective and mindful of the world around us â€” particularly how we feel on the inside about partnerships and life. By tapping into our internal resources, we can find the strength to make the necessary changes and the stamina to carry them through the season.Â CenteringÂ our energy on whatâ€™s important helps us realize that a lot of what we focus onÂ isnâ€™t. Clearing our minds gives us the clarity we need to grow and evolve.Â 

The Full Moon in Leo is a divine time to set intentions and manifest.Â IfÂ we are illuminating andÂ honoringÂ the repressed parts of ourselves that want to come out, we are on track. We can move forward and soldier on after we release the hidden aspects of our personality and creativity by putting them into play.Â Weâ€™reÂ deciding not to back down and to strive for happiness â€” no matter how messy the journey is to get there. The destination is going to be bumpy, but worth it in the end. Â 

With Mars in Aquarius opposing the Full Moon in Leo, it will be easy to get caught up in drama. Mars is known to instigate affairs, particularly by bringing up past situations. As a result, a line will be drawn in the sand, asking us to fight or take flight. We will be able to choose who is a friend or foe, and how we wish toÂ participateÂ in the matter. We might be pulled into a dynamic that pushes us to exert our frustrations or take the higher ground. Mars in Aquarius quarrels for whatÂ itâ€™sÂ most passionate about â€” particularly social injustice. If we feel that there is something thatÂ isnâ€™tÂ right for the community at large or even for ourselves in personal relationships, then we will get on our soapbox and take a stand.Â Â 

The truth is coming out, allowing us to hear the good, the bad, and the ugly. OurÂ perceptionÂ of others may change â€” not necessarily for the better. Knowing that we have been misled or need to step up protective measures might feel like a dagger to the heart, sinceÂ weâ€™veÂ been open and genuine with those whoÂ arenâ€™t. Rather than dwell, use it as a learning curve. The lesson is to put a boundary on the relationship to ensure it neverÂ transpiresÂ again. Fool us once, shame on them; fool us twice,Â itâ€™sÂ not ever happening. Words of advice: Do not feel bad about your part; understand that you can and will overcome anything in time. Never dwell on matters that are in the rearview mirror.Â 

Reflect on the matter at hand and conclude what or who deserves our attention and affection. Even though the Snow Moon is slightly chaotic, Leo energy focuses on our heartfelt sensations. Yes, there are letdowns, but the reasonÂ weâ€™reÂ feeling them so intensely is that we are hot-blooded creatures, full of emotions and passions. Our desires guide our actions, and our sentiments dictate our reactions. Do not hold back. SayÂ whatâ€™sÂ on your mind. Vocalizing the voice within isÂ a great wayÂ to be heard and seen.Â IfÂ youâ€™reÂ using it, that is what counts most.Â Â

title: The Best Weekend Sales Across Fashion, Beauty & Lifestyle
text:

Whether it's Lululemon's ol' reliable We Made Too Much section or a flash deal on best-selling skin-care brands, where there's a clearance rack, there's an R29 shopping editor ready to size up its price-slashed goods. Today, we bring you the best sales across fashion, beauty, wellness, and homeware happening this weekend. Gird your loins â€” or err, wallets.Â 

The deals on this list must meet at least one of the following criteria: The discount is applied to a Refinery29 reader-favorite brand (according to our anonymous shopping data), it takes a minimum of 20% off the full price, or it's an item that's rarely discounted, making even a slight price cut worth noting. All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.

title: The Top 2026 Denim Trends Ask You to Take Up Space
text:
The Top 2026 Denim Trends Ask You to Take Up Space

Fashion is starting to undergo a major shift. In 2026, as with beauty moving away from the pared-down â€œclean girlâ€ makeup trend, fashion is moving away from the mainstream minimalism of recent years. In its place is a moodier and maximal sensibility. What does this mean for jeans? Denim trends are going to inspire you to have way more fun as you get dressed in the months ahead.

One theme in particular is ruling over all popular 2026 denim: exaggeration. Prepare to take up space in baggy, inflated silhouettes with playful proportions. â€œComfort is a huge factor, but thereâ€™s also something about the relaxed look that just feels more modern right now,â€ Pistola Denim founder Grace Na tells Refinery29.

Skinny jeans arenâ€™t completely out of the picture â€” donâ€™t let us stop you if theyâ€™re your favorites â€” but tight, figure-hugging styles certainly wonâ€™t be dominating the conversation this year. Ultimately: â€œJeans should flex with how you feel, where youâ€™re going, and who you want to be that day or even that moment of your day,â€ Lâ€™Agence fashion director Tara Rudes Dann says.Â 

Ahead, meet the top 2026 denim trends to welcome into your wardrobe, as well as some useful shopping picks. But this isnâ€™t an experiment you have to test alone: We spoke to the forces behind some of our favorite brands to break down the looks, why theyâ€™re popular, and how to style them.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Barrel Jeans, With A Twist

Barrel-leg jeans came into the zeitgeist just a few years ago as a funky denim trend with questionable longevity. Yet naysayers should take heed that this silhouette is very much here to stay. This fashion-forward style features a very noticeable curve from the hip to the ankle, and that distinct shape is only going to keep getting more visible in the months ahead.

Itâ€™s worth noting that barrel jeans are also sometimes called a horseshoe or balloon jean, though the latter is a more exaggerated version of the look. â€œIt plays with volume in a really fresh way and adds a bit of fashion energy without feeling too intimidating,â€ Pistolaâ€™s Na says of the barrel-adjacent balloon.

Rather than intimidate you, you might find that barrel jeans are incredibly versatile when it comes to styling. Pair them with a blazer, polo shirt, and heels for an office-ready look, or try them with a cool-girl leather jacket and sneakers for brunch with friends.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Wide-Leg Jeans

Weâ€™ve been seeing lots of volume in pants and jeans from plenty of brands, so itâ€™s no surprise that wide-leg denim will be all over your social feeds and in your favorite stores in 2026. This comfortable cut was, after all, the viral opening look in Chanelâ€™s MÃ©tiers dâ€™art 2026 show â€”Â you know, the one held in a New York City subway station. Rather than hugging the body anywhere, this yearâ€™s class of wide-leg jeans shoot out from the waistband. These baggier silhouettes look great on everyone, and especially for petite wearers, a higher-sitting waist can help elongate the legs.

â€œThe baggy jean can be styled with a heel for a tailored look or worn with a sneaker for a weekend-ready look,â€ Paige co-founder and creative director Paige Adams-Geller says. The degree of baggy? Well, thatâ€™s buyerâ€™s choice, and thereâ€™s a range of whatâ€™s available.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Straight-Leg & Cigarette Jeans

Skinny jeans may not be as ubiquitous as they were during the hipster heyday of the 2010s, but skinny-ish silhouettes are still in vogue. Straight-leg and cigarette jeans (darlings of the â€˜80s and â€˜90s) are the top nominees here. Though these two silhouettes are very similar, thanks to their slim fit that goes straight down the leg, they differ in one key spot: cigarette jeans taper at the ankle.

The range of trends in the denim space are also a net positive for both your closet and a denim brandâ€™s creativity. â€œIt is exciting for us as designers but also for women because they can wear whatever suits them,â€ Tim Kaeding, co-founder of Mother Denim, tells Refinery29. â€œIt isnâ€™t like previous decades where one fit is dominating everything. It really is a cross-section between skinny and baggy.â€

Straight-leg and cigarette jeans work best in outfits that are all about clean lines â€”Â for one such example, look to Valentinoâ€™s Spring/Summer 2026 collection. Try adding a structured blazer or, for balance, a soft cardigan. If youâ€™re on the shorter side, it can be extra helpful to have these jeans tailored at the hem to ensure thereâ€™s no pooling at your feet. In a pinch, wearing heels or using some iron-on hemming tape can also help.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Maxing Out

Mirroring the longer and looser denim styles ruling the year, skirts are going midi and maxi. (If you love your denim mini skirt, simply stash it in storage â€” weâ€™re sure itâ€™ll come back in a few years.) The coolest denim skirts feature unique details like cool-enhancing asymmetric hems. Gravitating toward a more classic shape? Try a new-to-your-closet denim wash to mix things up.

There are endless ways to style these skirts, whether girly, sporty, or something else. We like pairing ours with a moto jacket and combat boots for some edge. A button-up, on the other hand, projects a more polished vibe.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Contemporary Bootcut Jeans

Raise your hand if you gotÂ  rid of any bootcut jeans you had left over from the early aughts. (We did too.) Yet, while the style is one of the major denim trends to watch in 2026, the new class of bootcut styles is far more modern than the jeans of yore. Instead of a distinct slim-to-flare cut, the refreshed bootcut is more subtle. Best of all, comfortable high-waisted styles are as easy to source as low-rise inseams that all but scream â€œY2K.â€Â 

â€œSheâ€™s confident, sexy and incredibly flattering,â€ Lâ€™Agenceâ€™s Rudes Dann says of the style. After all: â€œwomen want jeans that celebrate curves and command attention.â€

Making bootcut jeans feel current is also about how you style themÂ â€”Â and no, you arenâ€™t expected to only wear them with boots. Rock these jeans with loafers or pointed-toe heels for an elevated silhouette. For a more casual outfit, pair them with a white T-shirt, cool jacket, and skinny-soled sneakers.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Think Beyond Jeans

Your legs arenâ€™t the only place where denim can make a maximum impact. Expect to see designers use the material for shirts, dresses, and accessories in 2026.Â 

Want to rock a Canadian tuxedo or channel Britney Spearsâ€™ iconic denim-princess ballgown? Thatâ€™ll be easier than ever as brands continue to crank out shoes, bags, and outerwear all made with denim. Denim cowboy boots? Yes, (and thank you, BeyoncÃ©). A crossbody bag made from the same material? Never no.

â€œDenim jackets are showing up in sharper shapes in addition to the classic jean jacket,â€ Rudes Dann says of the all-denim everything trend of 2026. â€œThink bomber silhouettes and tailored blazers that feel structured but still easy and chic.â€

DashDividers_1_500x100

Jorts

Think of todayâ€™s most popular jorts â€”Â a portmanteau for jean shorts â€” as wide-leg denimâ€¦ for warmer weather. This style, which usually fits loose and hits below the knee if not right above it, is a seasonal interpretation of this yearâ€™s theme of comfort and ease. Style these with a snug shirt for proportional balance, or wear them with an oversized graphic tee to go full Adam Sandler.

DashDividers_1_500x100

Decorations & Details

Understated and unembellished jeans wonâ€™t ever lose their luster, but denim with an extra bit of flair is quickly becoming a favorite for the style-obsessed. Utility-inspired styles, like carpenter jeans, are staying mainstream, as are spunky styles that are decked out in embellishments. Pair these with a basic tee, jacket, and kicks to really let the jeans shine.
